definition: side of a ship or an aircraft

sentences.english: The damaged ship was leaning to port.
M/V Tian Shan following you will overtake you on your portside.
sentences.chinese: “天山”船跟隨你船並將從你船左舷追越。

sentences.english: The steam was shut off, and the Abraham Lincoln, beating to port, described a semicircle.
sentences.chinese: 汽門立刻被關掉了，林肯號從左舷轉了一百八十度。

sentences.english: We opened a white church to the port.
sentences.chinese: 左舷方面看出一座白塔來了。

sentences.english: Main deck E. R. entrance door port-door closer missing.
sentences.chinese: 主甲板機艙左舷入口門沒有閉合器。

sentences.english: The ship is listing to portside, please pay more attention.
Port diesel generator flywheel guard missing.
sentences.chinese: 左舷發電機飛輪罩沒有了。

sentences.english: Ship makes fast to lock on port side before gate closed.
sentences.chinese: 在閘門關閉前左舷靠妥船閘。

sentences.english: Met with a containership in the opposite course 8 miles off the port side.
sentences.chinese: 在左舷8海里外，遇到一艘對開的集裝箱船。

sentences.english: Make fast forward tug alongside on starboard.
sentences.chinese: 把停靠左舷的前拖船綁牢。

sentences.english: A container vessel is overtaking us from port side.
sentences.chinese: 一艘集裝箱船正從左舷追越我們。
把船操縱使風對左舷船尾。
還記得左舷是哪一邊嗎？

sentences.english: Keep two mooring boats on your port deck.
sentences.chinese: 兩隻帶纜艇吊放左舷甲板。

sentences.english: Lower one messenger rope to the mooring boat from portside.
sentences.chinese: 自左舷松下一根引纜給帶纜船。

definition: side of a ship or an aircraft
